comment.author: 38714066@N00
comment._content: Cookson - He commanded an Indian cavalry division.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Major General G.A. Cookson, 2d Indian Cavalry Division, formed in France in December, 1914. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2nd_Indian_Cavalry_Division Order of Battle of the British Army 1914 By Richard A. Rinaldi books.google.com/books?id=hzUZ-26KYQ4C&pg=PA110&l... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_battle_for_the_Battle_of_t... From a site related to India: 1928: Major General George Arthur Cookson CB (1911). CMG 1916. Son of late S.B Cookson, ISC; born 1860 educ. Wimbledon and R.M.C; married 1898 Evelyn Saradau of late Horace Cockerell, CSI, Ind. C.S., served on NW Frontier of India 1897-8, and in Great War 1914-19, with 2nd Indian Cavalry Div. Col. Royal Deccan Horse. Maj-Gen. Ind Army 1911, ret'd 1919, Halsdon nr Honiton Devon.

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks for catching the typo in the name and for the information (and sources!) about Cookson.  We'll adjust the description when we next update.
